Description: A Chian amphora of pale pink pottery, the exterior discoloured to patches of grey and white by salt action. The tall cylindrical neck is flanked by a pair of handles. The swelling body tapers to a peg-foot. The vessel is damaged, with a hole in the upper body.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 2, 18, 21, 51 or from the so-called "Camp" ?
Curator's comments: See also London, BM, EA 18674. According to Petrie's plate (pl. xxxiii, 2), the item might come from Findspot 2, 18, 21, 51 or from the so-called "Camp"
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58 (?), p. 64, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 2)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.112, p.201, pl.43)
